intro: Leptocaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and are accompanied by bracts. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Namibia. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
